revised_title: Faraday's Research on Diamagnetic Metals and Induced Currents
tldr: In this paper, Michael Faraday investigates the behavior of diamagnetic metals, such as bismuth and phosphorus, when placed in a magnetic field. He examines whether the observed effects are due to polarity or induced currents. Faraday concludes that the phenomena are closely related to the effects of induced currents and that the idea of diamagnetic polarity has not yet gained additional proof beyond the fact that diamagnetic bodies are repelled by magnetic poles.
